ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Right Posterior Canal Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo (BPPV)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Dix-Hallpike positioning to the right provoked intense vertigo and upbeating torsional nystagmus, characteristic of posterior canal BPPV.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Uncompensated Right Peripheral Vestibulopathy (Labyrinthine Concussion)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Caloric testing revealed a 50% right unilateral weakness, and functional testing (DVA, posturography) showed deficits in VOR and VSR consistent with uncompensated vestibular loss following head trauma.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Pure-tone audiometry demonstrated bilateral symmetric mild to moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tinnitus
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports constant ringing, matched to 3 kHz, with a high THI score indicating severe handicap.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To differentiate between mechanical (BPPV) and physiological (vestibulopathy) causes of dizziness given the history of head trauma.
To screen for vertebrobasilar insufficiency prior to positioning maneuvers that involve neck extension.

ordered_list.action: Functional vestibular testing (Dynamic Visual Acuity, Posturography)
ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess the functional impact of the vestibular deficit on gaze stability (VOR) and postural control (VSR).
To evaluate hearing status and characterize tinnitus pitch, loudness, and impact (THI).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Diagnosis of mixed vestibular pathology: Right PC-BPPV and Right Unilateral Peripheral Vestibulopathy. Positive VAST suggests contraindication for neck hyperextension.

tests.name: Dix-Hallpike Maneuver
tests.result_summary: Positive Right: Intense vertigo with upbeating torsional nystagmus.

tests.name: Dynamic Visual Acuity (DVA)
tests.result_summary: Degraded (82% static to 42% horizontal/60% vertical), indicating VOR impairment.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetric mild to moderately severe SNHL.

tests.name: Gans Repositioning Maneuver (GRM)
tests.result_summary: Performed twice; symptoms resolved in provoking position.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Confirmation of BPPV resolution following treatment.

tests.name: Vertebrobasilar Artery Screening Test (VAST) Recheck
tests.result_summary: Initially positive, then negative; suggests initial positive was BPPV-related.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Functional compensation achieved; tinnitus impact reduced.

tests.name: Functional Vestibular Testing
tests.result_summary: DVA scores improved (76% horiz / 72% vert); Static postural stability normal (no fall on dynamic surface with eyes closed).

tests.name: Headshake Test
tests.result_summary: Video-oculography showed no nystagmus, indicating VOR recovery.

tests.name: Questionnaires (DHI/THI)
tests.result_summary: DHI decreased from 85 to 4; THI decreased from 73 to 24.

proposed_items: Perform Gans Repositioning Maneuver (GRM) for Right PC-BPPV (chosen over Epley to avoid neck hyperextension due to positive VAST).
Refer for clinician-directed Vestibular Rehabilitation Therapy (VRT) with Physical Therapy (due to fall risk/severity).
Fit bilateral hearing aids to address hearing loss and provide tinnitus masking/enrichment.
Home VRT exercises (adaptation and habituation) to supplement clinic sessions.
counseling_actions: Explain that BPPV and the general imbalance are two separate issues; BPPV is mechanical and fixable quickly, while imbalance requires retraining (VRT).
Advise that VRT may initially increase symptoms but persistence is necessary for compensation.
Discuss the link between hearing loss and tinnitus, and how amplification can reduce tinnitus perception.
Counsel on BPPV recurrence rates (5-30%) and to return immediately if spinning returns.

red_flags_present: Fall on dynamic posturography (high fall risk)

escalation.rationale_short: Due to the severity of VSR dysfunction and fall risk, a self-directed home program is insufficient; professional supervision is required.

follow_up_plan.timeline: 1 week post-BPPV treatment; then ongoing during VRT; final review approx 5 months post-onset.
follow_up_plan.objective: Confirm clearance of BPPV, monitor functional compensation of VOR/VSR, and validate hearing aid benefit for tinnitus.

expected_outcome: Functional compensation of peripheral vestibulopathy (improved balance and gaze stability).
Significant reduction in Dizziness Handicap Inventory (DHI) score.
Reduced tinnitus perception and handicap (THI) via hearing aid use.
